intro: Anchusa perlata, commonly known as the blueweed or narrow-leaved anchusa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Anchusa perlata is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
